summary.p: 138 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: H. S. 164; Text: Q 1:1-Q 18:110; 15 lines per page; Dimensions: 250 x 170 mm; Script style: kūfī; Estimated date of production: 2nd (8th) to 3rd (9th) centuries [according to Karatay].

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 4: "10 H. S. 164 Kur’an’ın birinci yarısı Parşömen. 170mm boy ve 250mm eninde çönk biçimde 138 yaprak. Sahifede kûfî ile 195mm uzunl.[uğunda] 15 satır. Tahminen II - III. (VIII - IX) asırda yazılmış. Son sahifesi okunmayacak kadar kararmıştır. Sure başları yaldızlı. Harekeler kırmızı noktala konmuştur. Yazma ve yekşehli yaldız şemseli vişneçürüğü deri cilt. Bu mushaf başından Kahf (18) suresinin sonuna kadardır."

This can be translated as follows: "10 H. S. 164 The First Half of the Qurʾān Parchment. 138 junk shaped leaves of 170 mm height and 250 mm width. The text area written in Kufic script [contains] 15 lines measuring 195 mm. Probably copied during 2nd-3rd (8th-9th) centuries. The final page is too dark to read. Sūra headings are gilded. Vowel marks are marked with red dots. Cherry brown leather binding with yekshah and gilded mandorla (şemse). This codex is from [the first sūra] to the end of Q 18 (Sūra al-Kahf)."
